page.title: 11The Saracen's Head
page.content: The{Saracen's Head}was originally a coaching inn called the{King's Arms.} It was built in the early 12th century. It was then rebuilt some six hundred years ago. It changed its name to the{Saracen's Head}in 1651, after{ {Charles I}had been beheaded. Alot of famous people have stayed at the hotel like, Alvin Stardust, Selina Scott, David Essex. Some{royal}people have been to the hotel like, Richard I, King Henry III, King John, King Edward I, and{Charles I}whose{ghost}is said to run around the old part of the hotel{today.} In the hotel there are oil paintings and some antique furniture. There are {23}bedrooms all with{colour}T.V, radio, private bathroom and tea and coffee maker. They also have telephones.
